info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 7:51AM CDT until May 27 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...
East Fork Trinity River At McKinney affecting Collin County.
Elm Fork Trinity River Near Carrollton affecting Dallas County.
Denton Creek Near Justin affecting Denton County.
Trinity River At Dallas affecting Dallas County.
...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Texas...
White Rock Creek Near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave affecting Dallas County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Elm Fork Trinity River near Carrollton.
* WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Minor flooding will occur upstream from the gage, near the city golf course.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM CDT Monday the stage was 8.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this morning to 9.1 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon to 8.0 feet late this evening. It will rise to 8.7 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage.
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.water.noaa.gov/wfo/FWD.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT
